subject: Chemistry
q: How many moles of water are produced when 3 moles of hydrogen gas react completely with oxygen? (2H2 + O2 → 2H2O)

subject: Chemistry
q: How many moles of water are produced when 5 moles of hydrogen gas react completely with oxygen? (2H2 + O2 → 2H2O)
exp: Reaction stoichiometry: 2H2 + O2 → 2H2O. 2 moles H2 produce 2 moles H2O, so 5 moles H2 produce 5 moles H2O.

subject: Chemistry
q: A weak acid HA has Ka = 0.000463 and initial concentration 0.015 M. Using approximation, what is the hydrogen ion concentration [H+]?
exp: For weak acid HA, [H+] ≈ sqrt(Ka×c) = sqrt(0.000463×0.015) ≈ 0.002635 M.
